SourceProxy.name: AnalyzeMaterialClusters
SourceProxy.label: Analyze Material Clusters
SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter produces a multiblock dataset that contains two blocks: i/ the second block is a table that contains the volume (number of cells of every cluster) and barycenter of every cluster (set of connected cells that have the same point data material attribute) ; ii/ the first block is the input data image with new point data arrays that correspond to the volume and center of mass of the material cluster it belongs to.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the cluster analysis filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: ClusterLabel
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array that contains material labels.

IntVectorProperty.name: RockfillLabel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines what material should be considered as the rockfill. Volume of rockfill material will not be computed.

SourceProxy.name: ExplodeMaterialClusters
SourceProxy.label: Explode Material Clusters
SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter creates an exploded surface mesh of the clusters (set of connected cells that have the same material attribute) described in the input image data. This filter requires an initial analysis of the input data with the MaterialClusterAnalysis filter. If input is not the output of this filter (ie. it does not contain the metadata produced by this filter, the cluster centers in particular), then the filter will be called internally first.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: ClusterLabel
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array that contains material labels.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ExplodeFactor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines how far the points will be moved. The cluster points will be translated by this value times the vector that goes from the dataset center to the cluster barycenter.

IntVectorProperty.name: RockfillLabel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines what material should be considered as the rockfill. Rockfill material surface will not be exploded/computed.
